National Project in Agricultural Communications
AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF LAND-GRANT COLLEGES AND STATE UNIVERSITIES • AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE EDITORS
WELLS HALL • MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY
STANLEY ANDREWS EAST LANSING, MICHIGAN
Executive Director
January 31, 1958
Dr* Sam L* Becker, Director
Division of Television-Radio-Film
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
The enclosed letter to Ray Cheydleur reports progress to date on the
inventory-digest of radio research that was discussed briefly at the close
of the NAEB research seminar* In a sense, too, it's a follow up of my
letter of December 20.
The participants and consultants (I wrote to all of them) have sug¬
gested people and resource centers that might be approached as cooperators
in the proposed venture. At present, we're working along two lines: (1)
identifying the person or group to undertake the compilation of the pro¬
posed inventory; and, (2) exploring the possibility of making the project
a joint venture of NAEB, ETRC, and NPAC*
On the first point, Ken Harwood and his people have responded with
what looks like a workable plan and are in the process of drawing up a
formal proposal. No final decision has been made, but we're checking
with all of the people who offered comments and suggestions in reply to
my first "round robin" letter. On the second point, NAEB has agreed to
come in on a one-third-share basis, and I hope that ETRC will make a
similar decision.
That's where things stand at present. I'll keep in touch as the
project develops and would appreciate having any thoughts or reactions
that might occur to you.
Sincerely yours.
